citation.article-title: Pedobacter glucosidilyticus sp. nov., isolated from dry riverbed soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pedobacter glucosidilyticus sp. nov.

Pedobacter glucosidilyticus (glu.co.si.di.ly′ti.cus. N.L. n. glucosidum glucoside; Gr. adj. lutikos able to loosen, able to dissolve; N.L. adj. lyticus -a -um dissolving; N.L. masc. adj. glucosidilyticus glucoside-dissolving).
Cells stain Gram-negative and are non-spore-forming, non-flagellated and non-motile rods of 0.6–0.7 μm diameter and length 1.2–5.0 μm.
Colonies on 0.1×TSA (Difco) plates are circular, convex, smooth, cream to pink coloured and 1.0–2.0 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 28 °C.
Growth occurs from 15 to 37 °C (optimum, 30 °C), but not at 42 °C.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–3 % NaCl (w/v) (optimum, 0.5 %), but not in the presence of 5 % NaCl.
No growth occurs on MacConkey agar.
Oxidase, catalase, β-glucosidase and α-fucosidase activities are present, but DNase, heparinase, amylase and urease activities are absent.
Negative for nitrate reduction, production of H2S and indole and for hydrolysis of tyrosine, casein and Tween 40.

Dextrin, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, α-d-glucose, α-d-lactose, lactulose, maltose, d-mannose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, d-glucuronic acid and α-d-glucose 1-phosphate are utilized in the Biolog GN2 microplate.
Acid is produced from N-acetylglucosamine, arbutin, d-fructose, d-lactose and salicin.
The major fatty acids (>10 %) are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH and summed feature 3 (comprising iso-C16 : 1ω7c and/or C16 : 1ω6c).
The DNA G+C content is 37.2–37.6 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, 1-2T (=CCTCC AB 206110T=KCTC 22438T), was isolated from soil of the Tietongmen area in Tibet, China.
A reference strain, 1-4 (=CCTCC AB 206111), was isolated from the same source.
